titleStmt.title: To WILLIAM DARE MORGAN,William Dare Morgan (1838-87), son of CD’s friend Captain Elisha Ely Morgan (?1805-64). Joined his father’s shipping firm, the Black X Line, and spent most of the period 1861-4 in London, safeguarding the family’s interests during the American Civil War. See Leon Litvack, "Messages from the Sea: New Dickens Letters to E.E. and W.D. Morgan", Dickensian 110.2 (2014): 242-54. 8 February 1861

dateline.placeName: 3 Hanover Terrace, Regents Park N.W.CD rented this property from 14 February to 15 June 1861, so that his daughter Mamie could enjoy the London ‘Season’ (see Pilgrim Letters 9, p. 382; dated 1 February 1861).

body.p: We are in town for the season, at this address. If you have no better engagement for Sunday than to join our family dinner at 6 o’clock (exactly) we shall be truly glad to see you
